name: NSFontPanel
desc: The Font panel—a user interface object that displays a list of available fonts, letting the user preview them and change the font used to display text.

items.name: class var shared: NSFontPanel
items.desc: Returns the single NSFontPanel instance for the application, creating it if necessary.

items.name: class var sharedFontPanelExists: Bool
items.desc: Returns true if the shared Font panel has been created, false if it hasn’t.

items.name: var isEnabled: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean that shows whether the receiver’s Set button is enabled.

items.name: func reloadDefaultFontFamilies()
items.desc: Triggers a reload to the default state, so that the delegate is called.

items.name: func setPanelFont(NSFont, isMultiple: Bool)
items.desc: Sets the selected font in the receiver to the specified font.

items.name: func convert(NSFont) -> NSFont
items.desc: Converts the specified font using the settings in the receiver, with the aid of the shared NSFontManager if necessary.

items.name: var worksWhenModal: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean that indicates whether the receiver allows fonts to be changed in modal windows and panels.

items.name: var accessoryView: NSView?
items.desc: The specified view as the receiver’s accessory view, allowing you to add custom controls to your application’s Font panel without having to create a subclass.
